text: You were born and raised in the Kur Province, and your family lives there too. And yet you wish it had been destroyed...
Why would you say something like that about your hometown?
For me, my "family" is nothing but a scourge. A gathering of repulsive individuals and ideals which don't even deserve my contempt, let alone my affection.
Is it not natural, then, that I would wish for their ruin?
I don't understand at all! How could you think that?
The Trockel family used to be a line of alchemists, you see...although they abandoned its formal practice generations ago.
The family house was nevertheless a trove of alchemic literature, painstakingly collected over the years. And out of all my siblings, I was by far the most adept in the art.
Of course, the ignorant are wont to try to hammer down the nail that sticks out. My siblings, jealous of my talent, spared no effort in making my life miserable.
My mother, stung by my father's lack of interest in her, was no help. On the contrary, she saw me as the perfect target to vent her frustrations on.
One day, those brutes thought it would be amusing to test out some chemicals they had concocted on my face.
Weak as I was at the time, I was unable to escape, and my face was left a scarred mess.
And yet I continued to diligently focus on my studies. I excelled in every aspect of my aristocratic education and continued to hone my understanding of alchemy.
All of this to ensure I would be one day be ready to do my part in governing the province. Surely there would be no better application of my talents, I thought.
But all that changed when I came of age. You see, I unfortunately came to learn that there was one member of the family more witless than even my mother or siblings.
That was my father, Abraham Trockel. Imagine my shock when I learned that the only worth he saw in me was a pawn in some diplomatic marriage.
My disgust and disappointment were overwhelming.
And then, as if turning a blind eye to my true worth wasn't enough, he named my incompetent brother as his successor. I have never known a man more unfit to be a politician.
So that's why you hate your family so much...
From what I hear, it seems my father no longer even deigns to acknowledge my existence. Is that not so?
(Lord Trockel seemed so nice when we met him before...)
...It was around that time that I met Criselda.
(Criselda... I know that name. Empel mentioned that she leads the Polar Night Alchemists.)
Criselda healed my face using her alchemy and opened my eyes to alchemy's endless possibilities. A whole new world of opportunity, ready for the taking.
Once again I found myself enchanted by its power. And so I threw my old life away and joined the Polar Night Alchemists.
I swore to myself then and there that I would live life on my own termsâ€”beautifully, in a way completely unlike that of my former family.
And that I would found a magnificent kingdom, the sort a self-centered fool unfit to rule even the province entrusted to him could never begin to conceive of.
And that would be the Kingdom of Lara?
Well, I think that's quite enough reminiscing for now. Do feel free to spread the rotten truth about those imbeciles, by the way.
Pardon me, but might you be the alchemist Resna Sternenlicht?
Th-That's me! And you're...Lord Trockel, right? The minister of Kur Province? Is there something you need from me?
I wanted to personally thank those who helped save the province.
